     1â†’# Claude History CLI Tool - Project Plan
     2â†’
     3â†’**Document Version**: 2.8
     4â†’**Created**: 2026-02-01
     5â†’**Updated**: 2026-02-01 (Phase 10 planning)
     6â†’**Language**: Go
     7â†’**Status**: In Development (Phase 9 complete, Phase 10 planned)
     8â†’
     9â†’---
    10â†’
    11â†’## Executive Summary
    12â†’
    13â†’**claude-history** is a CLI tool that maps between filesystem paths and Claude Code's agent history storage, enabling programmatic querying of agent prompts, tool calls, and hierarchical agent spawning relationships.
    14â†’
    15â†’**Primary Use Cases**:
    16â†’1. Convert project directory paths â†’ Claude agent history JSONL locations
    17â†’2. Query agent history within date ranges and by entry type
    18â†’3. Traverse hierarchical agent spawning trees (agent â†’ subagent â†’ subagent)
    19â†’4. Filter and search tool calls within sessions
    20â†’5. Discover agents by criteria (files explored, tools used, time range)
    21â†’6. Export shareable HTML conversation history with expandable tool calls and subagents
    22â†’7. Use git-style prefix matching for session/agent IDs (no need for full UUIDs)
    23â†’8. Agent resurrection by reference - copy agent IDs and file paths for resurrection in Claude terminal
    24â†’
    25â†’**Target Platform**: Windows, macOS, Linux (cross-platform support)
    26â†’
    27â†’---
    28â†’
    29â†’## Design Decisions (Resolved)
    30â†’
    31â†’| Question | Decision | Rationale |
    32â†’|----------|----------|-----------|
    33â†’| CLI Framework | **Cobra** | Industry standard, subcommands, auto-generated help |
    34â†’| Architecture | **CLI-first** | Primary use case is command-line; library reuse via packages |
    35â†’| Streaming | **Yes (bufio.Scanner)** | Handle 10MB+ JSONL files without loading into memory |
    36â†’| External Dependencies | **Minimal** (Cobra only) | Keep binary small, reduce maintenance |
    37â†’| Path Encoding | **Dash-encoding** | Matches Claude Code's actual storage scheme |
    38â†’| Output Formats | **json, list, summary, ascii, dot** | Cover programmatic and human-readable needs |
    39â†’
    40â†’---
    41â†’
    42â†’## Technology Stack
    43â†’
    44â†’| Component | Technology | Rationale |
    45â†’|-----------|-----------|-----------|
    46â†’| **Language** | Go 1.21+ | Fast compilation, native binaries, excellent stdlib |
    47â†’| **CLI Framework** | Cobra v1.8+ | Command hierarchy, flags, auto-help |
    48â†’| **Testing** | Go `testing` package | Built-in, no external dependencies |
    49â†’| **Path Handling** | `filepath` package | Cross-platform path resolution |
    50â†’| **JSON Parsing** | `encoding/json` | Built-in, standard JSONL support |
    51â†’| **Build** | `go build` | Single binary output |
    52â†’
    53â†’---
    54â†’
    55â†’## Claude Code Storage Format
    56â†’
    57â†’### Path Encoding Scheme
    58â†’
    59â†’Claude Code encodes filesystem paths by replacing special characters with dashes:
    60â†’
    61â†’| Character | Replacement | Example |
    62â†’|-----------|-------------|---------|
    63â†’| `/` | `-` | `/home/user` â†’ `-home-user` |
    64â†’| `\` | `-` | `C:\Users` â†’ `C--Users` |
    65â†’| `:` | `-` | `C:` â†’ `C-` |
    66â†’| `.` | `-` | `.config` â†’ `-config` |
    67â†’
    68â†’**Storage Location**: `~/.claude/projects/{encoded-path}/`
    69â†’
    70â†’### Session Structure
    71â†’
    72â†’```
    73â†’~/.claude/projects/{encoded-path}/
    74â†’â”œâ”€â”€ sessions-index.json              # Session metadata cache (may be incomplete)
    75â†’â”œâ”€â”€ {sessionId}.jsonl                # Main session file
    76â†’â””â”€â”€ {sessionId}/
    77â†’    â””â”€â”€ subagents/
    78â†’        â”œâ”€â”€ agent-{agentId}.jsonl    # Subagent sessions
    79â†’        â””â”€â”€ agent-{agentId}/
    80â†’            â””â”€â”€ subagents/           # Nested subagents
    81â†’```
    82â†’
    83â†’### Entry Types
    84â†’
    85â†’| Type | Description | Has Text Content |
    86â†’|------|-------------|------------------|
    87â†’| `user` (string content) | Actual human prompt | âœ… Yes |
    88â†’| `user` (array content) | Tool results | âŒ No |
    89â†’| `assistant` | Claude responses (text + tool_use) | âœ… Yes |
    90â†’| `progress` | Hook/status updates | âŒ No |
    91â†’| `system` | System events | âŒ No |
    92â†’| `queue-operation` | Task queue management (enqueue/dequeue) | âŒ No |
    93â†’| `file-history-snapshot` | File state | âŒ No |
    94â†’| `summary` | Conversation summary | âœ… Yes |
    95â†’
    96â†’---
    97â†’
    98â†’## Project Structure
    99â†’
   100â†’```
   101â†’src/claude-history/
   102â†’â”œâ”€â”€ README.md
   103â†’â”œâ”€â”€ PROJECT_PLAN.md                    â† This file
   104â†’â”œâ”€â”€ go.mod
   105â†’â”œâ”€â”€ go.sum
   106â†’â”œâ”€â”€ main.go
   107â†’â”‚
   108â†’â”œâ”€â”€ cmd/                               # CLI commands
   109â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ root.go                        # Root command, global flags
   110â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ resolve.go                     # Path resolution
   111â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ list.go                        # List projects/sessions
   112â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ query.go                       # Query history
   113â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ tree.go                        # Agent hierarchy
   114â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ find_agent.go                  # Agent discovery (Phase 5)
   115â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ export.go                      # HTML export (Phase 6)
   116â†’â”‚
   117â†’â”œâ”€â”€ pkg/                               # Public packages (importable)
   118â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ encoding/
   119â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ encoding.go                # Path â†” encoded-path conversion
   120â†’â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ encoding_test.go
   121â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ paths/
   122â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ paths.go                   # Claude directory resolution
   123â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ platform.go                # Platform-specific handling
   124â†’â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ paths_test.go
   125â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ session/
   126â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ session.go                 # Session operations
   127â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ index.go                   # sessions-index.json parsing
   128â†’â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ session_test.go
   129â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ agent/
   130â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ agent.go                   # Agent discovery
   131â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ tree.go                    # Tree building
   132â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ discovery.go               # Agent search (Phase 5)
   133â†’â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ agent_test.go
   134â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ models/
   135â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ entry.go                   # ConversationEntry struct
   136â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ session.go                 # Session/Agent structs
   137â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ tools.go                   # Tool extraction (Phase 4)
   138â†’â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ models_test.go
   139â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ export/                        # Phase 6
   140â†’â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ html.go
   141â†’â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ manifest.go
   142â†’â”‚       â””â”€â”€ templates/
   143â†’â”‚
   144â†’â”œâ”€â”€ internal/
   145â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ jsonl/
   146â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ scanner.go                 # Streaming JSONL parser
   147â†’â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ scanner_test.go
   148â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ output/
   149â†’â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ formatter.go               # Output formatters
   150â†’â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ tree.go                    # ASCII tree renderer
   151â†’â”‚       â””â”€â”€ html.go                    # HTML formatter (Phase 6)
   152â†’â”‚
   153â†’â””â”€â”€ test/
   154â†’    â””â”€â”€ fixtures/
   155â†’        â”œâ”€â”€ sample-session.jsonl
   156â†’        â”œâ”€â”€ agent-session.jsonl
   157â†’        â””â”€â”€ sessions-index.json
   158â†’```
   159â†’

   267â†’
   268â†’### Bug Fixes âœ… COMPLETE
   269â†’
   270â†’- [x] Fix message content extraction (handle nested `{role, content}` structure)
   271â†’- [x] Scan all JSONL files on disk (not just sessions-index.json)
   272â†’- [x] Filter empty/aborted sessions (only file-history-snapshot entries)
   273â†’
   274â†’#### Bug Fix Details
   275â†’
   276â†’**1. Message Content Extraction**
   277â†’- **Problem**: `GetTextContent()` returned empty strings for user prompts
   278â†’- **Root Cause**: Claude Code wraps messages in `{role: "user", content: "..."}` envelope
   279â†’- **Fix**: Added `MessageWrapper` struct and `parseContent()` to unwrap the envelope before extracting text
   280â†’- **File**: `src/pkg/models/entry.go`
   281â†’
   282â†’**2. Session Index Incomplete**
   283â†’- **Problem**: `ListSessions()` only showed 2 sessions when 5 existed on disk
   284â†’- **Root Cause**: `sessions-index.json` is a cache that may not include all sessions
   285â†’- **Fix**: Always scan all JSONL files on disk, use index only for metadata enrichment
   286â†’- **File**: `src/pkg/session/session.go`
   287â†’
   288â†’**3. Empty/Aborted Sessions**
   289â†’- **Problem**: CLI showed sessions that were immediately exited (no conversation)
   290â†’- **Root Cause**: These sessions only contain `file-history-snapshot` entries with null timestamps
   291â†’- **Fix**: Added `hasConversation()` check - requires at least one `user` or `assistant` entry
   292â†’- **File**: `src/pkg/session/session.go`
   293â†’
   294â†’---
   295â†’
   296â†’## Upcoming Implementation
   297â†’
   298â†’### Phase 4: Tool Filtering âœ… COMPLETE
   299â†’
   300â†’**Priority**: HIGH
   301â†’**Status**: PR #5 open, all CI checks passing
   302â†’**PR**: https://github.com/randlee/claude-history/pull/5
   303â†’
   304â†’Add ability to filter by tool type and tool arguments in assistant messages.
   305â†’
   306â†’#### Requirements
   307â†’- Filter entries containing specific tool calls (case-insensitive matching)
   308â†’- Filter by tool arguments with regex matching
   309â†’- Show tool calls in query output with input summary
   310â†’
   311â†’#### CLI Usage
   312â†’```bash
   313â†’# Filter by tool type
   314â†’claude-history query /path --session <id> --tool bash
   315â†’claude-history query /path --session <id> --tool bash,read,write
   316â†’
   317â†’# Filter by tool arguments (regex)
   318â†’claude-history query /path --session <id> --tool bash --tool-match "python3"
   319â†’claude-history query /path --session <id> --tool bash --tool-match "grep.*db\.go"
   320â†’```
   321â†’
   322â†’#### Tool Types Reference
   323â†’
   324â†’| Tool Name | Description |
   325â†’|-----------|-------------|
   326â†’| `Bash` | Shell command execution |
   327â†’| `Read` | Read file contents |
   328â†’| `Write` | Write/create files |
   329â†’| `Edit` | Edit existing files |
   330â†’| `Task` | Spawn subagent |
   331â†’| `Glob` | File pattern matching |
   332â†’| `Grep` | Content search |
   333â†’| `WebFetch` | Fetch URL content |
   334â†’| `WebSearch` | Web search |
   335â†’| `NotebookEdit` | Jupyter notebook editing |
   336â†’| `AskUserQuestion` | Prompt user for input |
   337â†’
   338â†’#### Checklist

   341â†’  - [x] `ToolResult` struct (ToolUseID, Content, IsError)
   342â†’  - [x] `ExtractToolCalls()` method on ConversationEntry
   343â†’  - [x] `ExtractToolResults()` method on ConversationEntry

   351â†’  - [x] Implement tool filtering in `FilterEntries()`
   352â†’- [x] Update `cmd/query.go`
   353â†’  - [x] Add `--tool` flag (comma-separated, case-insensitive)

   355â†’  - [x] Validate tool names against known list (warn on unknown)
   356â†’- [x] Update `internal/output/formatter.go`

   361â†’

   363â†’| File | Action | Status |
   364â†’|------|--------|--------|
   365â†’| `pkg/models/tools.go` | Create | âœ… Done |
   366â†’| `pkg/models/tools_test.go` | Create | âœ… Done |
   367â†’| `pkg/session/session.go` | Modify | âœ… Done |

   392â†’
   393â†’#### Sprint 4a-1: Tool Models Tests (`pkg/models/tools.go`)
   394â†’
   395â†’**Target file**: `pkg/models/tools_test.go`
   396â†’
   397â†’**Test Requirements**:
   398â†’
   399â†’| Function | Test Cases Required |
   400â†’|----------|---------------------|
   401â†’| `ExtractToolCalls()` | - Assistant message with single tool call (Bash, Read, Write, Edit, Task, Glob, Grep, WebFetch, WebSearch, NotebookEdit, AskUserQuestion) |
   402â†’| | - Assistant message with multiple tool calls |
   403â†’| | - Assistant message with no tool calls (text only) |
   404â†’| | - Non-assistant entry type returns empty |
   405â†’| | - Malformed JSON content returns empty |
   406â†’| | - Missing required fields (id, name, input) handled gracefully |
   407â†’| | - Nested content wrapper `{role, content}` unwrapped correctly |
   408â†’| | - Direct content array parsed correctly |
   409â†’| `ExtractToolResults()` | - User message with single tool result |
   410â†’| | - User message with multiple tool results |
   411â†’| | - User message with error result (`is_error: true`) |
   412â†’| | - Non-user entry type returns empty |
   413â†’| | - Content as string vs content as array |
   414â†’| | - Malformed JSON handled gracefully |
   415â†’| `HasToolCall()` | - Exact match (e.g., "Bash") |
   416â†’| | - Case-insensitive match ("bash", "BASH", "BaSh") |
   417â†’| | - Tool not present returns false |
   418â†’| | - Multiple tools, one matches |
   419â†’| | - Empty tool name returns false |
   420â†’| | - Non-assistant entry returns false |
   421â†’| `MatchesToolInput()` | - Simple substring match |
   422â†’| | - Regex pattern match (e.g., `\.go$`) |
   423â†’| | - Pattern matches in any tool input |
   424â†’| | - No match returns false |
   425â†’| | - Invalid regex returns false (not panic) |
   426â†’| | - Empty pattern returns false |
   427â†’| | - Non-assistant entry returns false |
   428â†’| | - Tool with nil/empty input handled |
   429â†’
   430â†’**QA Verification**:
   431â†’- [x] All tests pass (`go test ./pkg/models/... -v`)
   432â†’- [x] No lint warnings (`golangci-lint run ./pkg/models/...`)
   433â†’- [x] Coverage > 90% for tools.go (achieved 90.2%)
   434â†’
   435â†’---
   436â†’
   437â†’#### Sprint 4a-2: Output Formatter Tests (`internal/output/formatter.go`)
   438â†’
   439â†’**Target file**: `internal/output/formatter_test.go`
   440â†’
   441â†’**Test Requirements**:
   442â†’
   443â†’| Function | Test Cases Required |
   444â†’|----------|---------------------|
   445â†’| `FormatToolCall()` | - Bash tool with command |
   446â†’| | - Read/Write/Edit tool with file_path |
   447â†’| | - Grep/Glob tool with pattern |
   448â†’| | - Task tool with description |
   449â†’| | - Task tool with prompt (fallback) |
   450â†’| | - Unknown tool falls back to JSON serialization |
   451â†’| | - Nil input returns `[ToolName]` only |
   452â†’| | - Empty input map returns `[ToolName]` only |
   453â†’| | - Input truncated at 80 chars with `...` |
   454â†’| | - Input exactly 80 chars (no truncation) |
   455â†’| | - Input 79 chars (no truncation) |
   456â†’| | - Input 81 chars (truncation) |
   457â†’| `FormatToolCalls()` | - Empty slice returns empty string |
   458â†’| | - Nil slice returns empty string |
   459â†’| | - Single tool formatted correctly |
   460â†’| | - Multiple tools joined with newlines |
   461â†’| `FormatToolSummary()` | - Empty slice returns empty string |
   462â†’| | - Single tool shows full format |
   463â†’| | - Multiple tools shows `[Tool1, Tool2, Tool3]` |
   464â†’| `extractToolDisplayValue()` | - Each tool type extracts correct key |
   465â†’| | - Missing key falls back to JSON |
   466â†’| | - Wrong type for expected key falls back to JSON |
   467â†’| `serializeInput()` | - Empty map returns empty string |
   468â†’| | - Simple map serializes to JSON |
   469â†’| | - Complex nested map serializes |
   470â†’
   471â†’**QA Verification**:
   472â†’- [x] All tests pass (`go test ./internal/output/... -v`)

   485â†’|----------|---------------------|
   486â†’| `FilterEntries()` with `ToolTypes` | - Single tool type filters correctly |

   488â†’| | - Case-insensitive tool matching |
   489â†’| | - Non-existent tool returns empty |
   490â†’| | - Empty ToolTypes does not filter |
   491â†’| | - Combined with existing filters (Types, StartTime, EndTime) |
   492â†’| `FilterEntries()` with `ToolMatch` | - Simple substring pattern |
   493â†’| | - Regex pattern (e.g., `git.*status`) |
   494â†’| | - Pattern in file path (e.g., `\.go$`) |
   495â†’| | - No match returns empty |
   496â†’| | - Invalid regex returns empty (not panic) |
   497â†’| | - Empty ToolMatch does not filter |
   498â†’| | - Combined with existing filters |
   499â†’| `FilterEntries()` with both | - Both ToolTypes AND ToolMatch must match |
   500â†’| | - ToolTypes matches but ToolMatch doesn't â†’ excluded |

Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

  1606â†’### Phase 10: HTML Export Enhancement ğŸ”„ IN PROGRESS (Wave 1 Complete)
  1607â†’
  1608â†’**Priority**: HIGH
  1609â†’**Status**: Wave 1 Complete (2026-02-02), Wave 2 In Progress
  1610â†’**Goal**: Transform HTML export into a beautiful, functional interface with agent resurrection capabilities
  1611â†’
  1612â†’#### Wave 1 Completion Summary âœ…
  1613â†’
  1614â†’**Completed**: 2026-02-02
  1615â†’**PR**: #22 (consolidated, merged to develop)
  1616â†’**Statistics**:
  1617â†’- 821 tests passing (100% pass rate)
  1618â†’- 91.2% test coverage on export package
  1619â†’- +3,574 lines of new code
  1620â†’- 0 linter issues

  1622â†’
  1623â†’**Features Delivered**:
  1624â†’1. **CSS Foundation (Sprint 10a)** - PR #21
  1625â†’   - CSS variable system with HSL color palette (neutral, blue, green, orange, red, purple, teal, amber)
  1626â†’   - Light/dark mode support via `prefers-color-scheme`
  1627â†’   - Chat bubble layout styles (user left, assistant right)
  1628â†’   - Typography system and animation utilities
  1629â†’
  1630â†’2. **Copy-to-Clipboard (Sprint 10c)** - Consolidated into PR #22
  1631â†’   - `clipboard.js` with navigator.clipboard API and execCommand fallback
  1632â†’   - Copy buttons for agent IDs, tool IDs, file paths, session IDs
  1633â†’   - Toast notifications and visual feedback
  1634â†’   - Dark mode support
  1635â†’
  1636â†’3. **Markdown/Syntax (Sprint 10e)** - Consolidated into PR #22

  1638â†’   - Support for headers, lists, tables, blockquotes, code blocks, task lists
  1639â†’   - Language badges with language-specific colors
  1640â†’   - Code block copy buttons
  1641â†’   - HTML escaping for XSS prevention
  1642â†’
  1643â†’**Worktrees**: All cleaned up (feature/phase10-css-foundation, feature/phase10-clipboard, feature/phase10-syntax)
  1644â†’
  1645â†’**GitHub Actions Note**: CI consolidation performed due to GitHub Actions infrastructure outage on 2026-02-02. All testing and validation completed locally with full verification.
  1646â†’
  1647â†’#### Motivation
  1648â†’
  1649â†’The current HTML export is functional but lacks visual polish and critical features for agent resurrection workflows. Analysis of claude-code-viewer's HTML export revealed superior UX patterns that should be adopted.
  1650â†’
  1651â†’**Key User Needs**:
  1652â†’1. **Visual Clarity**: Chat-style layout (user left, assistant right) for better readability
  1653â†’2. **Agent Resurrection**: Easy copy-paste of agent IDs and file paths for resurrection in Claude terminal
  1654â†’3. **Navigation**: Deep-dive into subagent conversations with breadcrumb trails
  1655â†’4. **Code Quality**: Syntax highlighting, proper formatting, copy buttons
  1656â†’5. **Professional Polish**: Color-coded sections, smooth animations, responsive design
  1657â†’
  1658â†’#### Requirements
  1659â†’
  1660â†’**Visual Design**:
  1661â†’- Chat bubble layout: user messages left-aligned, assistant messages right-aligned
  1662â†’- CSS variable system with HSL colors for dynamic theming
  1663â†’- Color-coded expandable overlays:
  1664â†’  - Tools: Blue/teal with wrench icon ğŸ”§
  1665â†’  - Subagents: Purple/violet with agent icon ğŸ¤–
  1666â†’  - Thinking blocks: Gray/muted with lightbulb icon ğŸ’¡
  1667â†’  - System messages: Yellow/amber with info icon â„¹ï¸
  1668â†’- Modern typography with clear hierarchy
  1669â†’- Smooth CSS transitions for expand/collapse
  1670â†’- Dark mode with proper color adaptation
  1671â†’
  1672â†’**Copy-to-Clipboard Functionality** (Critical):
  1673â†’- **Agent IDs**: Copy button next to every agent reference with context:
  1674â†’  ```
  1675â†’  Clicked: Copies "a12eb64-8119-4209-9fbe-ea07e164d142"
  1676â†’  Tooltip: "Copy agent ID for resurrection"
  1677â†’  ```
  1678â†’- **File Paths**: Copy button for every Read/Write/Edit tool:
  1679â†’  ```
  1680â†’  Read: /path/to/file.go [ğŸ“‹ Copy]
  1681â†’  Tooltip: "Copy file path"
  1682â†’  ```
  1683â†’- **Session IDs**: Copy button in header metadata
  1684â†’- **Tool IDs**: Copy button for tool use IDs (for debugging)
  1685â†’- **JSONL Paths**: Copy button for agent JSONL file paths (resurrection source)
  1686â†’
  1687â†’**Agent Resurrection Context**:
  1688â†’When copying an agent ID, include metadata in tooltip:
  1689â†’```
  1690â†’Agent: a12eb64
  1691â†’Session: fbd51e2b-8119-4209-9fbe-ea07e164d142
  1692â†’Path: /Users/name/project
  1693â†’JSONL: ~/.claude/projects/-Users-name-project/fbd51e2b.../agent-a12eb64.jsonl
  1694â†’Entries: 168
  1695â†’Created: 2026-01-28 19:20:58
  1696â†’```
  1697â†’
  1698â†’**Subagent Deep Dive**:
  1699â†’- Click subagent â†’ expands inline with full conversation
  1700â†’- Breadcrumb navigation: `Main > Agent a12eb64 > Agent a68b8c0`
  1701â†’- Visual nesting with indentation
  1702â†’- "Jump to parent" button to return
  1703â†’- Lazy-load nested agents on demand
  1704â†’
  1705â†’**Code & Formatting**:
  1706â†’- Syntax highlighting with Prism.js or highlight.js
  1707â†’- Language badges on code blocks
  1708â†’- Copy button for all code blocks
  1709â†’- Preserve all newlines in output
  1710â†’- Format JSON with indentation
  1711â†’- Monospace for tool inputs/outputs
  1712â†’
  1713â†’**Interactive Features**:
  1714â†’- "Expand All / Collapse All" button with state tracking
  1715â†’- Search/filter functionality
  1716â†’- Keyboard shortcuts (Ctrl+K to toggle all)
  1717â†’- Smooth scroll to active element
  1718â†’- localStorage persistence for collapse states
  1719â†’
  1720â†’**Markdown Support**:
  1721â†’- Render markdown in assistant messages
  1722â†’- Styled headers, tables, blockquotes, task lists
  1723â†’- Code blocks with language detection
  1724â†’- Inline code with background
  1725â†’- Links with hover states
  1726â†’
  1727â†’#### Development Workflow
  1728â†’
  1729â†’**CRITICAL**: All development MUST follow this workflow using sc-git-worktree:
  1730â†’
  1731â†’```
  1732â†’â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
  1733â†’â”‚ 1. CREATE WORKTREES (sc-git-worktree)                                   â”‚
  1734â†’â”‚    MANDATORY: Use sc-git-worktree for all development work              â”‚
  1735â†’â”‚    - Main feature worktree from develop                                 â”‚
  1736â†’â”‚    - Parallel worktrees for independent sprints                         â”‚
  1737â†’â”‚    - Isolated environments prevent conflicts                            â”‚
  1738â†’â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤
  1739â†’â”‚ 2. DEPLOY BACKGROUND DEV AGENT                                          â”‚
  1740â†’â”‚    MANDATORY: Use background Task agents for all implementation         â”‚
  1741â†’â”‚    - Each sprint gets dedicated background dev agent                    â”‚
  1742â†’â”‚    - Agent works in isolated worktree                                   â”‚
  1743â†’â”‚    - No manual code changes - agents do all implementation              â”‚
  1744â†’â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤
  1745â†’â”‚ 3. DEPLOY BACKGROUND QA AGENT (MANDATORY - NO EXCEPTIONS)               â”‚
  1746â†’â”‚    CRITICAL: Every dev sprint MUST be followed by dedicated QA sprint   â”‚
  1747â†’â”‚                                                                         â”‚
  1748â†’â”‚    â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”                        â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”                â”‚

  1772â†’â”‚    IF ISSUES FOUND â†’ Return to Dev Agent for fixes                      â”‚
  1773â†’â”‚    ONLY WHEN QA APPROVES â†’ Proceed to PR                                â”‚
  1774â†’â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤
  1775â†’â”‚ 4. PR TO DEVELOP (only after QA approval)                               â”‚
  1776â†’â”‚    - Push branch, create PR                                             â”‚
  1777â†’â”‚    - Wait for CI checks                                                 â”‚
  1778â†’â”‚    - Merge after approval                                               â”‚
  1779â†’â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¤
  1780â†’â”‚ 5. CLEANUP WORKTREES (sc-git-worktree)                                  â”‚
  1781â†’â”‚    - Remove worktrees after merge                                       â”‚
  1782â†’â”‚    - Delete local branches                                              â”‚
  1783â†’â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
  1784â†’```
  1785â†’
  1786â†’**Key Principles**:
  1787â†’1. **sc-git-worktree is MANDATORY** - Never work directly in main worktree
  1788â†’2. **Background agents are MANDATORY** - No manual implementation
  1789â†’3. **QA agent per sprint is MANDATORY** - No sprint is complete without QA approval
  1790â†’4. **No shortcuts** - Every sprint follows full workflow
  1791â†’5. **Quality gates enforced** - QA must approve before merge
  1792â†’
  1793â†’#### Development Sprints (Parallel Execution via sc-git-worktree)
  1794â†’

--- # ARCH-HIST Context Restoration ## **Project Overview** **claude-history** is a Go CLI tool that provides programmatic access to Claude Code's agent history storage. It maps between filesystem paths and Claude's internal dash-encoded storage format (`/Users/name/project` â†’ `-Users-name-project`), enabling querying, filtering, and export of conversation history. The tool supports hierarchical agent discovery, tool call filtering, git-style prefix matching for IDs, and HTML export with agent resurrection capabilities. ## **Current Status** | Phase | Description | Status | |-------|-------------|--------| | 1-4 | Foundation, Path Resolution, Session/Agent Discovery, Tool Filtering | âœ… Complete | | 4a | Test Coverage Sprints (90%+ coverage) | âœ… Complete | | 5-7 | Agent Discovery, HTML Export, Prefix Matching | âœ… Complete | | 8-9 | Export Integration, Data Model Alignment | âœ… Complete | | **10 Wave 1** | CSS Foundation, Copy-to-Clipboard, Markdown/Syntax | âœ… **Complete** | | **10 Wave 2** | Chat Bubble Layout, Overlays, Interactive Controls | ğŸ”„ **Next** | | 10 Wave 3 | Deep Dive Navigation, Header/Footer, Integration | ğŸ”² Planned | ## **Wave 1 Summary** (Completed 2026-02-02) **PR #22** (merged to develop): - **821 tests passing** (100% pass rate) - **91.2% test coverage** on export package - **+3,574 lines** of new code - **0 linter issues** **Features Delivered**: 1. **Sprint 10a** - CSS variable system with HSL colors, light/dark mode, chat bubble styles 2. **Sprint 10c** - Clipboard infrastructure with navigator.clipboard API, copy buttons, toast notifications 3. **Sprint 10e** - Markdown rendering with headers, tables, code blocks, language badges ## **Wave 2 Plan** | Sprint | Feature | Worktree | Dependencies | |--------|---------|----------|--------------| | **10b** | Chat Bubble Layout | `wt/phase10-chat-layout` | 10a (complete) | | **10d** | Color-Coded Overlays | `wt/phase10-overlays` | 10a (complete) | | **10g** | Interactive Controls | `wt/phase10-controls` | None (parallel) | **Execution Strategy**: - Run **10b** and **10d** in parallel (both depend only on 10a which is complete) - Run **10g** independently (no dependencies) - Each sprint gets: dedicated worktree â†’ dev agent â†’ QA agent â†’ fix loop â†’ PR **Quality Gates** (MANDATORY per sprint): - 100% test pass rate - >85% coverage on new code - Zero linter errors - Manual verification - QA approval before PR --- **Ready to begin Wave 2 execution?**

# /sc-git-worktree command Use this command to manage worktrees following the repo's layout and tracking rules. - Repo root: current directory. - Default worktree path: `../{{REPO_NAME}}-worktrees/<branch>` (override in skill/agent config if needed). - Default tracking doc: `../{{REPO_NAME}}-worktrees/worktree-tracking.md` (toggle off or override if the repo doesn't track worktrees). - Branch strategy: configure per repo (e.g., master for release, develop/integration, feature off integration, hotfix off master). - Safety: never alter dirty worktrees without explicit approval; respect branch protections/hooks (no direct commits to protected branches). ## Protected Branches Configuration Protected branches (main, develop, master) require special handling to prevent accidental deletion. Configure using: ```yaml git_flow: enabled: true # boolean: whether git-flow workflow is used main_branch: "main" # or "master" - the primary production branch develop_branch: "develop" # only if git_flow.enabled = true protected_branches: - "main" - "develop" - "master" ``` **Protected Branch Rules:** - Cleanup/abort operations NEVER delete protected branches (local or remote) - Protected branches can only be removed from worktrees, never deleted - Use `--update` to safely pull changes for protected branches in worktrees - If git_flow.enabled is false, only main_branch is protected (default: "main") - If git_flow.enabled is true, both main_branch and develop_branch are protected - **Required**: All operations involving branch deletion must provide protected_branches list; operations fail if missing If run with no options or `--help`: print a concise list of options (no git status) and prompt with a numbered choice for list/status, create, cleanup, or abort; then gather required inputs. ## Behavior ### Common steps - Ensure scaffolding: `<worktree_base>` exists; create if missing. Ensure tracking doc exists with headers if tracking is enabled. - `git fetch --all --prune` before create/cleanup decisions. - Keep tracking doc in sync on every operation when enabled. ### --list / --status - `git worktree list --porcelain`. - Cross-check tracking doc; report missing/stale entries and dirty states via `git -C <path> status --short`. - Agent option: call `sc-worktree-scan` and render its JSON as a table and bullet recommendations. ### --create - Inputs: branch, base. - Path: `../{{REPO_NAME}}-worktrees/<branch>` by default. - If branch exists: `git worktree add <path> <branch>`; else `git worktree add -b <branch> <path> <base>`. - Verify hooks/branch protections apply; confirm `git status` clean. - Update tracking row (branch, path, base, purpose, owner, created, status, last checked, notes) when tracking is enabled. - Agent option: call `sc-worktree-create`; render as a table plus warnings/errors. ### --update - **Protected branches only** - verify branch is in protected_branches list before proceeding. - Inputs: branch name (required). Must be a protected branch (main, develop, master, etc.). - Derive protected_branches list from git_flow config (main_branch + develop_branch if enabled) or fail with clear error if config missing. - Check if worktree exists for the branch; error if missing. - Check `git -C <path> status`; if dirty, stop and report uncommitted changes. - Fetch and pull: `git fetch origin <branch>` then `git pull origin <branch>`. - **If merge conflicts occur:** - Report conflicted files to user - Return control to main session for user to resolve conflicts - User navigates to worktree, resolves conflicts, and commits - After resolution, user can re-run --update to verify - **If clean pull succeeds:** - Report commits pulled count - Update tracking with last_checked timestamp when tracking is enabled - Agent option: call `sc-worktree-update`; render success or handle conflicts interactively. ### --cleanup - **Check if branch is protected first** - derive protected_branches list from git_flow config or fail if missing. - If branch is in protected_branches list, ONLY remove worktree, NEVER delete the branch. - Check `git -C <path> status`; if dirty, stop and request explicit approval/coordination. - Confirm branch merged/approved for removal. - `git worktree remove <path>` (force only with approval). - For **non-protected branches**: If merged and has no unique commits, delete the branch locally (`git branch -d <branch>`) and remotely (`git push origin --delete <branch>`) by default. Only retain the branch if the user explicitly opts out. If the remote branch is already gone, continue without error. If not merged, only delete branches (local/remote) with explicit approval. - For **protected branches**: Only remove worktree, preserve branch locally and remotely. Update tracking to note "worktree removed, branch preserved (protected)". - Update tracking (remove or mark cleaned with merge SHA/date) when tracking is enabled. - Agent option: call `sc-worktree-cleanup` with protected_branches list; render its JSON as a short summary list. ### --abort - **Check if branch is protected first** - derive protected_branches list from git_flow config or fail if missing. - If branch is in protected_branches list, ONLY remove worktree, NEVER delete the branch. - Check `git -C <path> status`; if dirty, stop and request explicit approval/coordination. - `git worktree remove <path>` (force only with approval). - For **non-protected branches**: If requested, delete branch locally (`git branch -D <branch>`) and remotely (`git push origin --delete <branch>`). - For **protected branches**: Only remove worktree, preserve branch locally and remotely. Require confirmation: "Branch is protected. Remove worktree but preserve branch?" - Update tracking to remove the entry and note abandonment when tracking is enabled. - Agent option: call `sc-worktree-abort` with protected_branches list; render its JSON as a short summary list. ### --help - Show options and remind about base branches, paths, tracking toggles, and dirty-worktree safeguards. Keep output concise (no tool traces). ARGUMENTS: create feature/phase10-chat-layout --base develop

```json

  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "action": "create",
    "branch": "feature/phase10-controls",
    "base": "develop",

The implementation includes: ### Files Created 1. **`/Users/randlee/Documents/github/claude-history-worktrees/feature/phase10-controls/src/pkg/export/templates/controls.js`** - IIFE pattern with strict mode for clean scoping - **Expand/Collapse functionality**: `expandAllTools()`, `collapseAllTools()`, `toggleAllTools()` - **Search functionality**: - `performSearch()` with text highlighting using `<mark>` elements - `clearSearch()` to remove all highlights - `navigateToMatch()`, `nextMatch()`, `prevMatch()` for search navigation - `highlightTextInElement()` using TreeWalker for efficient text node traversal - **Keyboard shortcuts**: - `Ctrl+K` / `Cmd+K` - Toggle all collapsibles - `Ctrl+F` / `Cmd+F` - Focus search box (prevents browser default) - `Escape` - Clear search and blur input - `Enter` / `Shift+Enter` - Navigate to next/previous match - **localStorage persistence**: Save and restore collapse states - **Smooth scroll**: Scroll to elements accounting for sticky header - **Public API**: `window.ControlsAPI` object for programmatic access 2. **`/Users/randlee/Documents/github/claude-history-worktrees/feature/phase10-controls/src/pkg/export/controls_test.go`** - 48 comprehensive tests covering: - JavaScript content validation (functions, classes, API) - HTML control panel structure - CSS styles verification - File writing and embedding - Accessibility attributes - <task-notification> <task-id>a52c2b7</task-id> <status>completed</status> <summary>Agent "Sprint 10b: Chat Bubble Layout" completed</summary> <result>Excellent! All new functions have 100% coverage. Let me provide a summary of the changes I made. ## Summary I have successfully implemented Sprint 10b: Chat Bubble Layout for the claude-history CLI. Here are the changes made: ### 1. Updated `pkg/export/html.go` **Modified `renderEntry()` function** to use the new chat bubble structure: - Changed from `<div class="entry ...">` to `<div class="message-row ...">` - Added avatar placeholder with `<div class="avatar ...">` and `aria-hidden="true"` for accessibility - Added `<div class="message-bubble">` wrapper - Changed header structure from `entry-header` with `type` span to `message-header` with `role` span - Changed content wrapper from `content` to `message-content` **Added new helper functions:** - `getRoleLabel(entryType)` - Returns human-readable role labels ("User", "Assistant", "System", "Agent Task", "Summary") - `formatTimestampReadable(timestamp)` - Formats timestamps as readable times (e.g., "2:30 PM" instead of "14:30:45") ### 2. Updated `pkg/export/templates/style.css` **Enhanced chat bubble styles:** - Added avatar placeholder styles with different colors for each message type - User avatar: Blue background with "U" initial - Assistant avatar: Green background with "A" initial - System avatar: Neutral background with "S" initial - Queue operation avatar: Orange background with "T" initial - Summary avatar: Purple background with sigma symbol **Added message-row styles for all types:** - System, queue-operation, and summary messages with appropriate colors - Unknown message type fallback styling - Updated max-width from 70% to 80% for better readability **Improved header layout:** - Added gap between elements - Added flex-wrap for long agent IDs - Agent ID now uses monospace font **Added responsive and dark mode styles:** - Smaller avatars on mobile (28px instead of 36px) - Dark mode color adjustments for avatars ### 3. Created `pkg/export/html_chat_test.go` New comprehensive test file with 25+ test functions covering: - Chat bubble layout for all message types (user, assistant, system, queue-operation, summary) - Timestamp formatting (AM/PM format, edge cases like midnight/noon) - Avatar placeholders and accessibility (aria-hidden) - Message bubble structure and ordering - Edge cases (empty content, null content, very long content, multiline, special characters) - Role labels for all entry types - Conversation flow with multiple messages - Tool calls inside bubbles - Data attributes (data-uuid) - Markdown rendering for assistant messages ### 4. Updated existing tests **Updated `pkg/export/html_test.go`:** - Changed tests to look for `class="message-row ..."` instead of `class="entry ..."` - Updated timestamp test to check for readable format ("2:30 PM") - Renamed `TestRenderConversation_TypeInHeader` to `TestRenderConversation_RoleInHeader` **Updated `cmd/export_html_test.go`:** - Changed HTML structure checks to match new message-row classes ### Quality Gates Met - **100% test pass**: All tests pass across all packages - **>85% coverage**: 91.4% coverage on pkg/export (new functions have 100% coverage) - **Zero lint errors**: golangci-lint reports no issues ### Files Modified 1. `/Users/randlee/Documents/github/claude-history-worktrees/feature/phase10-chat-layout/src/pkg/export/html.go` 2. `/Users/randlee/Documents/github/claude-history-worktrees/feature/phase10-chat-layout/src/pkg/export/templates/style.css` 3. `/Users/randlee/Documents/github/claude-history-worktrees/feature/phase10-chat-layout/src/pkg/export/html_test.go` 4. `/Users/randlee/Documents/github/claude-history-worktrees/feature/phase10-chat-layout/src/cmd/export_html_test.go` ### File Created 1. `/Users/randlee/Documents/github/claude-history-worktrees/feature/phase10-chat-layout/src/pkg/export/html_chat_test.go`</result> </task-notification> Full transcript available at: /private/tmp/claude-501/-Users-randlee-Documents-github-claude-history/tasks/a52c2b7.output

Here is a summary of the Sprint 10d implementation: --- ## Sprint 10d: Color-Coded Expandable Overlays - Implementation Complete ### Files Created 1. **`/Users/randlee/Documents/github/claude-history-worktrees/feature/phase10-overlays/src/pkg/export/overlays.go`** (290 lines) - `ToolInfo` struct for tool metadata (icon, hint, color class, display name) - `toolRegistry` map with 14 tool types (Bash, Read, Write, Edit, Grep, Glob, Task, WebFetch, WebSearch, NotebookEdit, TodoRead, TodoWrite, ToolSearch, Skill) - `GetToolInfo(toolName string)` - returns tool metadata with fallback for unknown tools - `RenderToolOverlay(tool, result, hasResult)` - generates collapsible tool overlay HTML with: - Tool-specific icons and color classes - Character count hints (input/output) - Copy buttons for tool ID, file path (for file tools), input, and output - Collapsible header/body structure with chevron indicator - `RenderSubagentOverlay(agentID, entryCount, metadata)` - generates subagent overlay with: - Robot icon - Truncated agent ID display (7 chars) - Entry count metadata - Copy button for full agent ID - "Deep Dive" button - Optional metadata section - `RenderThinkingOverlay(thinking)` - generates thinking block overlay with: - Lightbulb icon - Character count - Collapsible content - `ExtractThinkingBlocks(entry)` - extracts thinking blocks from assistant messages - Helper functions: `formatCharCount`, `formatSingleCharCount`, `formatSize` 2. **`/Users/randlee/Documents/github/claude-history-worktrees/feature/phase10-overlays/src/pkg/export/overlays_test.go`** (669 lines) - Comprehensive tests for all overlay functions - 35 test functions covering: - Tool info retrieval for known/unknown tools - Tool overlay rendering (Bash, Read, file paths, errors, all tool types) - Character count formatting - XSS prevention - Subagent overlay rendering (short/long IDs, metadata, empty metadata) - Thinking overlay rendering (basic structure, char count) - Thinking block extraction from assistant messages ### Files Modified 3. **`/Users/randlee/Documents/github/claude-history-worktrees/feature/phase10-overlays/src/pkg/export/templates/style.css`** (+672 lines) - Linter Results ``` golangci-lint: 0 issues go vet: No errors ``` **VERIFIED**: Zero errors, zero warnings. ### 4. Code Review Verification #### pkg/export/overlays.go (290 lines) - [x] ToolInfo struct with Icon, Hint, ColorClass, DisplayName - [x] toolRegistry with all 14 tool types: - Bash, Read, Write, Edit, Grep, Glob, Task, WebFetch, WebSearch, NotebookEdit, TodoRead, TodoWrite, ToolSearch, Skill - [x] GetToolInfo with fallback for unknown tools (returns "tool-unknown" class, wrench emoji, preserves name) - [x] RenderToolOverlay with: - Collapsible structure with `collapsible`, `collapsed` classes - Copy buttons (tool ID, file path for file tools, input, output) - Character counts in formatted sizes (chars, K chars) - XSS prevention via escapeHTML - [x] RenderSubagentOverlay with: - Robot emoji icon - Deep Dive button with `deepDiveAgent(agentId, event)` handler - Copy button for agent ID - Metadata section (optional) - [x] RenderThinkingOverlay with lightbulb emoji, character count - [x] ExtractThinkingBlocks properly filters for type == "thinking" from assistant messages #### pkg/export/templates/style.css (2155 lines, +672 new) - [x] Tool overlay base styles (.tool-overlay) - [x] Color classes for all tool types: - .tool-bash (teal) - .tool-read (blue) - .tool-write (green) - .tool-edit (amber) - .tool-grep, .tool-websearch, .tool-search (purple) - .tool-glob (neutral) - .tool-task (violet/agent colors) - .tool-webfetch (teal) - .tool-notebook (orange) - .tool-todo (neutral) - .tool-skill (teal) - .tool-unknown (default teal) - [x] Subagent overlay styles (purple/violet via CSS variables) - [x] Thinking block styles (gray/muted via CSS variables) - [x] Smooth transitions (max-height, opacity via CSS variables) - [x] Chevron rotation animation (.chevron.down.rotated transforms) - [x] Dark mode variants (full @media (prefers-color-scheme: dark) section) #### pkg/export/templates/script.js (386 lines, +93 new) - [x] toggleToolOverlay function (toggles expanded class and collapsed on body) - [x] toggleThinking function (toggles expanded class and collapsed on body) - [x] deepDiveAgent function (stops propagation, loads content, expands, scrolls) - [x] Updated expandAll/collapseAll to handle .tool-overlay and .thinking-overlay ### 5. Edge Cases Verified in Tests - [x] Very long tool inputs: TestRenderToolOverlay_CharacterCount tests 10K+ char counts - [x] Tool outputs with special characters (XSS prevention): 3 XSS tests (TestRenderToolOverlay_XSSPrevention, TestRenderSubagentOverlay_XSSPrevention, TestRenderThinkingOverlay_XSSPrevention) - [x] Nested subagents: RenderSubagentOverlay handles any agentId - [x] Multiple thinking blocks in sequence: TestExtractThinkingBlocks_AssistantWithThinking tests 2 blocks - [x] Unknown tool types fall back gracefully: TestGetToolInfo_UnknownTool - [x] Empty tool input/output handled: TestRenderToolOverlay_NilInput, TestExtractThinkingBlocks_EmptyThinking ### 6. Visual Correctness Check - [x] Tool colors match specification (verified in CSS) - [x] Icons are correct emoji characters (verified in overlays.go registry) - [x] Copy buttons have appropriate tooltips (renderCopyButton includes title attribute) ### 7. All acceptance criteria have been met: 1. **Functionality**: All overlay rendering functions work correctly with proper structure, styling classes, and interactive handlers. 2. **Testing**: 28 test functions in overlays_test.go with comprehensive coverage of edge cases including XSS prevention, nil handling, unknown tools, and character count formatting. 3. **Code Quality**: Zero linter issues, 92.5% coverage, proper Go conventions followed. 4. **CSS/JS**: Complete color-coded styling for all 14 tool types plus unknown fallback, with dark mode support and smooth animations. 5. **Security**: XSS prevention via html.EscapeString throughout all rendering functions. [Read] /Users/randlee/Documents/github/claude-history/docs/PROJE...
{
  "file_path": "/Users/randlee/Documents/github/claude-history/docs/PROJECT_PLAN.md",
  "limit": 50,

     1â†’# Claude History CLI Tool - Project Plan
     2â†’
     3â†’**Document Version**: 2.8
     4â†’**Created**: 2026-02-01
     5â†’**Updated**: 2026-02-01 (Phase 10 planning)
     6â†’**Language**: Go
     7â†’**Status**: In Development (Phase 9 complete, Phase 10 planned)
     8â†’
     9â†’---
    10â†’
    11â†’## Executive Summary
    12â†’
    13â†’**claude-history** is a CLI tool that maps between filesystem paths and Claude Code's agent history storage, enabling programmatic querying of agent prompts, tool calls, and hierarchical agent spawning relationships.
    14â†’
    15â†’**Primary Use Cases**:
    16â†’1. Convert project directory paths â†’ Claude agent history JSONL locations
    17â†’2. Query agent history within date ranges and by entry type
    18â†’3. Traverse hierarchical agent spawning trees (agent â†’ subagent â†’ subagent)
    19â†’4. Filter and search tool calls within sessions
    20â†’5. Discover agents by criteria (files explored, tools used, time range)
    21â†’6. Export shareable HTML conversation history with expandable tool calls and subagents
    22â†’7. Use git-style prefix matching for session/agent IDs (no need for full UUIDs)
    23â†’8. Agent resurrection by reference - copy agent IDs and file paths for resurrection in Claude terminal
    24â†’
    25â†’**Target Platform**: Windows, macOS, Linux (cross-platform support)
    26â†’
    27â†’---
    28â†’
    29â†’## Design Decisions (Resolved)
    30â†’
    31â†’| Question | Decision | Rationale |
    32â†’|----------|----------|-----------|
    33â†’| CLI Framework | **Cobra** | Industry standard, subcommands, auto-generated help |
    34â†’| Architecture | **CLI-first** | Primary use case is command-line; library reuse via packages |
    35â†’| Streaming | **Yes (bufio.Scanner)** | Handle 10MB+ JSONL files without loading into memory |
    36â†’| External Dependencies | **Minimal** (Cobra only) | Keep binary small, reduce maintenance |
    37â†’| Path Encoding | **Dash-encoding** | Matches Claude Code's actual storage scheme |
    38â†’| Output Formats | **json, list, summary, ascii, dot** | Cover programmatic and human-readable needs |
    39â†’
    40â†’---
    41â†’
    42â†’## Technology Stack
    43â†’
    44â†’| Component | Technology | Rationale |
    45â†’|-----------|-----------|-----------|
    46â†’| **Language** | Go 1.21+ | Fast compilation, native binaries, excellent stdlib |
    47â†’| **CLI Framework** | Cobra v1.8+ | Command hierarchy, flags, auto-help |
    48â†’| **Testing** | Go `testing` package | Built-in, no external dependencies |
    49â†’| **Path Handling** | `filepath` package | Cross-platform path resolution |
    50â†’| **JSON Parsing** | `encoding/json` | Built-in, standard JSONL support |

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

   162â†’## Implementation Status
   163â†’
   164â†’### Completed Phases
   165â†’- âœ… Phase 1: Foundation (encoding, JSONL parser, Cobra setup)
   166â†’- âœ… Phase 2: Path Resolution (resolve command)
   167â†’- âœ… Phase 3: Session & Agent Discovery (list, query, tree commands)
   168â†’- âœ… Phase 4: Tool Filtering (`--tool`, `--tool-match` flags)
   169â†’- âœ… Phase 4a: Test Coverage Sprints (90%+ coverage achieved)

  1606â†’
  1607â†’### Phase 10: HTML Export Enhancement ğŸ”„ IN PROGRESS (Wave 1 Complete)
  1608â†’
  1609â†’**Priority**: HIGH
  1610â†’**Status**: Wave 1 Complete (2026-02-02), Wave 2 In Progress
  1611â†’**Goal**: Transform HTML export into a beautiful, functional interface with agent resurrection capabilities
  1612â†’
  1613â†’#### Wave 1 Completion Summary âœ…
  1614â†’
  1615â†’**Completed**: 2026-02-02
  1616â†’**PR**: #22 (consolidated, merged to develop)
  1617â†’**Statistics**:
  1618â†’- 821 tests passing (100% pass rate)
  1619â†’- 91.2% test coverage on export package
  1620â†’- +3,574 lines of new code
  1621â†’- 0 linter issues
  1622â†’- Clean build (6.2 MB binary)
  1623â†’
  1624â†’**Features Delivered**:
  1625â†’1. **CSS Foundation (Sprint 10a)** - PR #21
  1626â†’   - CSS variable system with HSL color palette (neutral, blue, green, orange, red, purple, teal, amber)
  1627â†’   - Light/dark mode support via `prefers-color-scheme`
  1628â†’   - Chat bubble layout styles (user left, assistant right)
  1629â†’   - Typography system and animation utilities
  1630â†’
  1631â†’2. **Copy-to-Clipboard (Sprint 10c)** - Consolidated into PR #22
  1632â†’   - `clipboard.js` with navigator.clipboard API and execCommand fallback
  1633â†’   - Copy buttons for agent IDs, tool IDs, file paths, session IDs
  1634â†’   - Toast notifications and visual feedback
  1635â†’   - Dark mode support
  1636â†’
  1637â†’3. **Markdown/Syntax (Sprint 10e)** - Consolidated into PR #22
  1638â†’   - `markdown.go` with full markdown-to-HTML conversion
  1639â†’   - Support for headers, lists, tables, blockquotes, code blocks, task lists
  1640â†’   - Language badges with language-specific colors
  1641â†’   - Code block copy buttons
  1642â†’   - HTML escaping for XSS prevention
  1643â†’
  1644â†’**Worktrees**: All cleaned up (feature/phase10-css-foundation, feature/phase10-clipboard, feature/phase10-syntax)
  1645â†’
  1646â†’**GitHub Actions Note**: CI consolidation performed due to GitHub Actions infrastructure outage on 2026-02-02. All testing and validation completed locally with full verification.
  1647â†’
  1648â†’#### Motivation
  1649â†’
  1650â†’The current HTML export is functional but lacks visual polish and critical features for agent resurrection workflows. Analysis of claude-code-viewer's HTML export revealed superior UX patterns that should be adopted.
  1651â†’
  1652â†’**Key User Needs**:
  1653â†’1. **Visual Clarity**: Chat-style layout (user left, assistant right) for better readability
  1654â†’2. **Agent Resurrection**: Easy copy-paste of agent IDs and file paths for resurrection in Claude terminal
  1655â†’3. **Navigation**: Deep-dive into subagent conversations with breadcrumb trails

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.

Now let me summarize what has been implemented. ## Summary I have successfully implemented Sprint 10f: Deep Dive Navigation for the claude-history CLI. Here's what was created and modified: ### New Files Created 1. **`/Users/randlee/Documents/github/claude-history-worktrees/feature/phase10-navigation/src/pkg/export/templates/navigation.js`** - IIFE pattern with 'use strict' - `expandSubagent(agentId)` - loads and displays agent conversation inline with lazy loading - `collapseSubagent(agentId)` - collapses agent back to summary - `updateBreadcrumbs(path)` - updates breadcrumb trail showing navigation path - `scrollToAgent(agentId)` - smooth scroll to agent element with highlight animation - `navigateBack()` / `navigateForward()` - navigation history support - `jumpToParent(agentId)` - jump to parent agent from nested context - State persistence with localStorage - Keyboard navigation: Alt+Left (back), Alt+Right (forward), Alt+Up (parent), Escape (to main) - Public API via `window.NavigationAPI` - Legacy support for `window.deepDiveAgent` 2. **`/Users/randlee/Documents/github/claude-history-worktrees/feature/phase10-navigation/src/pkg/export/navigation.go`** - `BreadcrumbItem` struct for breadcrumb path items - `RenderBreadcrumbs()` - generates HTML breadcrumb navigation - `RenderJumpToParentButton()` - generates "Jump to Parent" button - `RenderAgentContainer()` - wraps agent content with proper IDs and controls - `RenderNestedSubagentOverlay()` - enhanced subagent overlay with navigation controls - `GenerateBreadcrumbPath()` - creates breadcrumb path from agent IDs - `TruncateAgentID()` - utility for truncating agent IDs for display 3. **`/Users/randlee/Documents/github/claude-history-worktrees/feature/phase10-navigation/src/pkg/export/navigation_test.go`** - Comprehensive tests for all navigation functions -      2â†’
     3â†’**Document Version**: 2.9

     8â†’
     9â†’---
    10â†’
    11â†’## Executive Summary
    12â†’
    13â†’**claude-history** is a CLI tool that maps between filesystem paths and Claude Code's agent history storage, enabling programmatic querying of agent prompts, tool calls, and hierarchical agent spawning relationships.
    14â†’
    15â†’**Primary Use Cases**:

  1668â†’   - `overlays.go` with tool registry (14 tool types with icons, hints, colors)
  1669â†’   - Tool overlays: Bash=teal, Read=blue, Write=green, Edit=amber, Grep=purple

  1671â†’   - Thinking block overlays (gray/muted with ğŸ’¡ icon)

  1673â†’

  1675â†’   - `controls.js` with expand/collapse all functionality

  1677â†’   - Keyboard shortcuts: Ctrl+K (toggle), Ctrl+F (search), Esc (clear)

  1679â†’   - Sticky header with control panel
  1680â†’
  1681â†’**Worktrees**: feature/phase10-chat-layout, feature/phase10-overlays, feature/phase10-controls (to be cleaned up)
  1682â†’
  1683â†’#### Motivation
  1684â†’
  1685â†’The current HTML export is functional but lacks visual polish and critical features for agent resurrection workflows. Analysis of claude-code-viewer's HTML export revealed superior UX patterns that should be adopted.
  1686â†’
  1687â†’**Key User Needs**:
  1688â†’1. **Visual Clarity**: Chat-style layout (user left, assistant right) for better readability
  1689â†’2. **Agent Resurrection**: Easy copy-paste of agent IDs and file paths for resurrection in Claude terminal
  1690â†’3. **Navigation**: Deep-dive into subagent conversations with breadcrumb trails
  1691â†’4. **Code Quality**: Syntax highlighting, proper formatting, copy buttons
  1692â†’5. **Professional Polish**: Color-coded sections, smooth animations, responsive design
  1693â†’
  1694â†’#### Requirements
  1695â†’
  1696â†’**Visual Design**:
  1697â†’- Chat bubble layout: user messages left-aligned, assistant messages right-aligned
  1698â†’- CSS variable system with HSL colors for dynamic theming

  2186â†’      <div class="session-metadata">
  2187â†’        <span class="meta-item">
  2188â†’          Session: <code>fbd51e2b <button class="copy-btn">ğŸ“‹</button></code>
  2189â†’        </span>
  2190â†’        <span class="meta-item">Project: /Users/name/project</span>
  2191â†’        <span class="meta-item">Exported: 2026-02-01 22:39:20</span>
  2192â†’        <span class="meta-item">Messages: 914</span>
  2193â†’        <span class="meta-item">Agents: 11</span>
  2194â†’        <span class="meta-item">Tools: 247 calls</span>
  2195â†’      </div>
  2196â†’      <div class="controls"><!-- from Sprint 10g --></div>
  2197â†’    </header>
  2198â†’    ```
  2199â†’  - [ ] Add footer:
  2200â†’    ```html
  2201â†’    <footer class="page-footer">
  2202â†’      <div class="footer-info">
  2203â†’        <p>Exported from <strong>claude-history</strong> CLI</p>
  2204â†’        <p>Export format version: 2.0</p>
  2205â†’        <p>Source: <code>~/.claude/projects/... <button class="copy-btn">ğŸ“‹</button></code></p>
  2206â†’      </div>
  2207â†’      <div class="footer-help">
  2208â†’        <details>
  2209â†’          <summary>Keyboard Shortcuts</summary>
  2210â†’          <ul>
  2211â†’            <li><kbd>Ctrl+K</kbd> - Expand/Collapse All</li>
  2212â†’            <li><kbd>Ctrl+F</kbd> - Search</li>
  2213â†’            <li><kbd>Ctrl+C</kbd> - Copy Agent ID</li>
  2214â†’          </ul>
  2215â†’        </details>
  2216â†’      </div>
  2217â†’    </footer>
  2218â†’    ```

[Grep] Sprint 10i

  

    
{
  "-A": 50,
  "output_mode": "content",
  "path": "/Users/randlee/Documents/github/claude-history/docs/PROJECT_PLAN.md",
  "pattern": "Sprint 10i"
}

    
7:**Status**: In Development (Phase 10 Wave 3 in progress, Sprint 10i remaining)
8-
9----
10-
11-## Executive Summary
12-
13-**claude-history** is a CLI tool that maps between filesystem paths and Claude Code's agent history storage, enabling programmatic querying of agent prompts, tool calls, and hierarchical agent spawning relationships.
14-
15-**Primary Use Cases**:
16-1. Convert project directory paths â†’ Claude agent history JSONL locations
17-2. Query agent history within date ranges and by entry type
18-3. Traverse hierarchical agent spawning trees (agent â†’ subagent â†’ subagent)
19-4. Filter and search tool calls within sessions
20-5. Discover agents by criteria (files explored, tools used, time range)
21-6. Export shareable HTML conversation history with expandable tool calls and subagents
22-7. Use git-style prefix matching for session/agent IDs (no need for full UUIDs)
23-8. Agent resurrection by reference - copy agent IDs and file paths for resurrection in Claude terminal
24-
25-**Target Platform**: Windows, macOS, Linux (cross-platform support)
26-
27----
28-
29-## Design Decisions (Resolved)
30-
31-| Question | Decision | Rationale |
32-|----------|----------|-----------|
33-| CLI Framework | **Cobra** | Industry standard, subcommands, auto-generated help |
34-| Architecture | **CLI-first** | Primary use case is command-line; library reuse via packages |
35-| Streaming | **Yes (bufio.Scanner)** | Handle 10MB+ JSONL files without loading into memory |
36-| External Dependencies | **Minimal** (Cobra only) | Keep binary small, reduce maintenance |
37-| Path Encoding | **Dash-encoding** | Matches Claude Code's actual storage scheme |
38-| Output Formats | **json, list, summary, ascii, dot** | Cover programmatic and human-readable needs |
39-
40----
41-
42-## Technology Stack
43-
44-| Component | Technology | Rationale |
45-|-----------|-----------|-----------|
46-| **Language** | Go 1.21+ | Fast compilation, native binaries, excellent stdlib |
47-| **CLI Framework** | Cobra v1.8+ | Command hierarchy, flags, auto-help |
48-| **Testing** | Go `testing` package | Built-in, no external dependencies |
49-| **Path Handling** | `filepath` package | Cross-platform path resolution |
50-| **JSON Parsing** | `encoding/json` | Built-in, standard JSONL support |
51-| **Build** | `go build` | Single binary output |
52-
53----
54-
55-## Claude Code Storage Format
56-
57-### Path Encoding Scheme
--
180:- ğŸ”„ Phase 10 Wave 3: Sprint 10i Integration & Polish (final sprint)
181-
182-### Planned
183-- ğŸ”² Future enhancements (see detailed plan below)
184-
185----
186-
187-### Phase 1: Foundation âœ… COMPLETE
188-
189-- [x] Go module setup (`go.mod`, `go.sum`)
190-- [x] Cobra CLI framework integration
191-- [x] Path encoding/decoding (`pkg/encoding/`)
192-  - [x] `EncodePath()` - filesystem path â†’ encoded format
193-  - [x] `DecodePath()` - encoded format â†’ filesystem path
194-  - [x] `IsEncodedPath()` - detect encoded paths
195-  - [x] Unit tests for Unix and Windows paths
196-- [x] Streaming JSONL parser (`internal/jsonl/`)
197-  - [x] `Scanner.Scan()` - stream large files
198-  - [x] `ScanInto[T]()` - generic typed scanning
199-  - [x] `ReadAll[T]()` - load entire file
200-  - [x] `CountLines()` - count valid entries
201-  - [x] 10MB line buffer for large entries
202-  - [x] Unit tests
203-
204-### Phase 2: Path Resolution âœ… COMPLETE
205-
206-- [x] Claude directory resolution (`pkg/paths/`)
207-  - [x] `DefaultClaudeDir()` - get ~/.claude
208-  - [x] `ProjectsDir()` - get projects directory
209-  - [x] `ProjectDir()` - encode path to project directory
210-  - [x] `SessionFile()` - get session JSONL path
211-  - [x] `AgentFile()` - get agent JSONL path
212-  - [x] `ListProjects()` - enumerate all projects
213-  - [x] `ListSessionFiles()` - enumerate session files
214-  - [x] `ListAgentFiles()` - enumerate agent files
215-  - [x] Cross-platform support (Windows, macOS, Linux)
216-  - [x] Unit tests
217-- [x] `resolve` command (`cmd/resolve.go`)
218-  - [x] Resolve project path â†’ encoded directory
219-  - [x] Resolve session ID â†’ JSONL file path
220-  - [x] Resolve agent ID â†’ agent JSONL path
221-  - [x] `--format json|path` flag
222-  - [x] Hidden `encode` and `decode` subcommands for testing
223-
224-### Phase 3: Session & Agent Discovery âœ… COMPLETE
225-
226-- [x] Data models (`pkg/models/`)
227-  - [x] `ConversationEntry` struct with all fields
228-  - [x] `Session` and `SessionIndexEntry` structs

--
1710:- Sprint 10i: Integration & Polish (final sprint)
1711-
1712-**Worktrees**: feature/phase10-navigation (to be cleaned up), feature/phase10-chrome (active)
1713-
1714-#### Motivation
1715-
1716-The current HTML export is functional but lacks visual polish and critical features for agent resurrection workflows. Analysis of claude-code-viewer's HTML export revealed superior UX patterns that should be adopted.
1717-
1718-**Key User Needs**:
1719-1. **Visual Clarity**: Chat-style layout (user left, assistant right) for better readability
1720-2. **Agent Resurrection**: Easy copy-paste of agent IDs and file paths for resurrection in Claude terminal
1721-3. **Navigation**: Deep-dive into subagent conversations with breadcrumb trails
1722-4. **Code Quality**: Syntax highlighting, proper formatting, copy buttons
1723-5. **Professional Polish**: Color-coded sections, smooth animations, responsive design
1724-
1725-#### Requirements
1726-
1727-**Visual Design**:
1728-- Chat bubble layout: user messages left-aligned, assistant messages right-aligned
1729-- CSS variable system with HSL colors for dynamic theming
1730-- Color-coded expandable overlays:
1731-  - Tools: Blue/teal with wrench icon ğŸ”§
1732-  - Subagents: Purple/violet with agent icon ğŸ¤–
1733-  - Thinking blocks: Gray/muted with lightbulb icon ğŸ’¡
1734-  - System messages: Yellow/amber with info icon â„¹ï¸
1735-- Modern typography with clear hierarchy
1736-- Smooth CSS transitions for expand/collapse
1737-- Dark mode with proper color adaptation
1738-
1739-**Copy-to-Clipboard Functionality** (Critical):
1740-- **Agent IDs**: Copy button next to every agent reference with context:
1741-  ```
1742-  Clicked: Copies "a12eb64-8119-4209-9fbe-ea07e164d142"
1743-  Tooltip: "Copy agent ID for resurrection"
1744-  ```
1745-- **File Paths**: Copy button for every Read/Write/Edit tool:
1746-  ```
1747-  Read: /path/to/file.go [ğŸ“‹ Copy]
1748-  Tooltip: "Copy file path"
1749-  ```
1750-- **Session IDs**: Copy button in header metadata
1751-- **Tool IDs**: Copy button for tool use IDs (for debugging)
1752-- **JSONL Paths**: Copy button for agent JSONL file paths (resurrection source)
1753-
1754-**Agent Resurrection Context**:
1755-When copying an agent ID, include metadata in tooltip:
1756-```
1757-Agent: a12eb64
1758-Session: fbd51e2b-8119-4209-9fbe-ea07e164d142
1759-Path: /Users/name/project
1760-JSONL: ~/.claude/projects/-Users-name-project/fbd51e2b.../agent-a12eb64.jsonl

2442:- **Wave 4** (Day 4): ğŸ”² PLANNED - Sprint 10i (integration - depends on all)
2443-  - Integration & Polish
2444-- **Final QA**: Comprehensive verification
2445-
2446-#### Agent Resurrection Workflow Example
2447-
2448-**Use Case**: User wants to ask detailed questions about a subagent that explored beads repo
2449-
2450-1. **Export session to HTML**:
2451-   ```bash
2452-   ./claude-history export /path --session fbd51e2b --format html
2453-   ```
2454-
2455-2. **Open HTML in browser**, find agent `adccc2e` that explored beads files
2456-
2457-3. **Click copy button** next to agent ID â†’ copies:
2458-   ```
2459-   a12eb64-8119-4209-9fbe-ea07e164d142
2460-   ```
2461-
2462-4. **Paste in Claude terminal**:
2463-   ```
2464-   Tell me about agent a12eb64-8119-4209-9fbe-ea07e164d142
2465-   ```
2466-
2467-5. **Claude locates and resurrects agent**, can answer questions about its work
2468-
2469-**Alternative**: Copy JSONL path directly:
2470-```
2471-~/.claude/projects/-Users-name-project/fbd51e2b.../subagents/agent-a12eb64.jsonl
2472-```
2473-
2474----
2475-
2476-## Testing Strategy
2477-
2478-### Unit Tests
2479-- All packages have corresponding `_test.go` files
2480-- Test edge cases: empty files, malformed JSON, missing fields
2481-- Test cross-platform: Windows paths with `\`, Unix paths with `/`
2482-- Coverage target: >80%
2483-
2484-### Integration Tests
2485-- Use test fixtures in `test/fixtures/`
2486-- Test full command execution with sample data
2487-- Test round-trip encoding/decoding
2488-
2489-### Cross-Platform Requirements
2490-- Path handling: use `filepath.Join()`, never string concatenation
2491-- Temp folders: use `os.TempDir()`, never hardcoded `/tmp`
2492-- Line endings: handle both `\r\n` and `\n` in JSONL

I have completed Sprint 10i, the final sprint of Phase 10 HTML Export Enhancement. Here is what was accomplished:

- Sprint 10d: Color-coded tool overlays verification

- Sprint 10f: Deep dive navigation with breadcrumbs verification
- Sprint 10g: Interactive controls with search verification
- Sprint 10h: Header/footer with session metadata verification
- Accessibility (ARIA labels, roles, live regions)
- HTML Structure validation

**Workflow Tests**
- `TestIntegration_AgentResurrectionWorkflow` - Copy agent ID flow
- `TestIntegration_SearchFunctionality` - Search components
- `TestIntegration_KeyboardShortcuts` - Keyboard shortcut documentation
- `TestIntegration_SessionStats` - Statistics computation
- `TestIntegration_ToolResultMatching` - Tool call/result pairing

**Quality Tests**
- `TestIntegration_CSSPrintStyles` - Print stylesheet verification
- `TestIntegration_CSSResponsiveStyles` - Mobile/dark mode
- `TestIntegration_CSSAccessibility` - Screen reader support, focus states
- `TestIntegration_JSModulesComplete` - All JS functions present
- `TestIntegration_JSDebounce` - Search debounce implementation
- `TestIntegration_ScriptLoadOrder` - Correct script loading order
- `TestIntegration_CSSColorContrast` - HSL color variables

**Edge Case & Performance Tests**
- `TestIntegration_LargeConversation` - 1000 entries performance
- `TestIntegration_EmptyConversation` - Empty input handling
- `TestIntegration_SpecialCharacters` - Unicode & special chars
- `TestIntegration_AllEntryTypes` - All 5 entry types render

1. **All tests pass**: `go test ./...` - All 100+ tests pass

3. **Zero linter issues**: `golangci-lint run ./...` reports 0 issues

The integration tests confirmed all Phase 10 components from previous sprints are properly integrated:

- **CSS Variable System** - HSL color palette with 7+ color scales, semantic variables
- **Chat Bubble Layout** - Message rows with avatars, directional bubbles
- **Copy-to-clipboard** - Copy buttons for agent IDs, file paths, session IDs, tool IDs
- **Color-coded Overlays** - 14 tool type color schemes
- **Syntax Highlighting** - Code blocks with language badges
- **Deep Dive Navigation** - Breadcrumbs, lazy loading, keyboard navigation
- **Interactive Controls** - Expand/collapse, search with debounce
- **Header/Footer** - Session metadata, keyboard shortcuts help

### Print Stylesheet

Verified existing comprehensive print styles including:
- Force light mode colors
- Hide interactive controls  
- Expand all collapsibles
- Page break handling
- Disable animations

### Accessibility

Verified existing ARIA implementation:
- `role="toolbar"` on controls
- `aria-label` on inputs and buttons
- `aria-live="polite"` on search results
- `aria-hidden="true"` on decorative elements
- `aria-current="page"` on active breadcrumb
- `.sr-only` utility class
- Focus state styles

02:22:38 user

  
# /sc-git-worktree command

Use this command to manage worktrees following the repo's layout and tracking rules.
- Repo root: current directory.
- Default worktree path: `../{{REPO_NAME}}-worktrees/<branch>` (override in skill/agent config if needed).
- Default tracking doc: `../{{REPO_NAME}}-worktrees/worktree-tracking.md` (toggle off or override if the repo doesn't track worktrees).
- Branch strategy: configure per repo (e.g., master for release, develop/integration, feature off integration, hotfix off master).
- Safety: never alter dirty worktrees without explicit approval; respect branch protections/hooks (no direct commits to protected branches).

## Protected Branches Configuration

Protected branches (main, develop, master) require special handling to prevent accidental deletion. Configure using:

```yaml
git_flow:
  enabled: true  # boolean: whether git-flow workflow is used
  main_branch: "main"  # or "master" - the primary production branch
  develop_branch: "develop"  # only if git_flow.enabled = true

protected_branches:
  - "main"
  - "develop"
  - "master"
```

**Protected Branch Rules:**
- Cleanup/abort operations NEVER delete protected branches (local or remote)
- Protected branches can only be removed from worktrees, never deleted
- Use `--update` to safely pull changes for protected branches in worktrees
- If git_flow.enabled is false, only main_branch is protected (default: "main")
- If git_flow.enabled is true, both main_branch and develop_branch are protected
- **Required**: All operations involving branch deletion must provide protected_branches list; operations fail if missing

If run with no options or `--help`: print a concise list of options (no git status) and prompt with a numbered choice for list/status, create, cleanup, or abort; then gather required inputs.

## Behavior

### Common steps
- Ensure scaffolding: `<worktree_base>` exists; create if missing. Ensure tracking doc exists with headers if tracking is enabled.
- `git fetch --all --prune` before create/cleanup decisions.
- Keep tracking doc in sync on every operation when enabled.

### --list / --status
- `git worktree list --porcelain`.
- Cross-check tracking doc; report missing/stale entries and dirty states via `git -C <path> status --short`.
- Agent option: call `sc-worktree-scan` and render its JSON as a table and bullet recommendations.

### --create
- Inputs: branch, base.
- Path: `../{{REPO_NAME}}-worktrees/<branch>` by default.
- If branch exists: `git worktree add <path> <branch>`; else `git worktree add -b <branch> <path> <base>`.
- Verify hooks/branch protections apply; confirm `git status` clean.
- Update tracking row (branch, path, base, purpose, owner, created, status, last checked, notes) when tracking is enabled.
- Agent option: call `sc-worktree-create`; render as a table plus warnings/errors.

### --update
- **Protected branches only** - verify branch is in protected_branches list before proceeding.
- Inputs: branch name (required). Must be a protected branch (main, develop, master, etc.).
- Derive protected_branches list from git_flow config (main_branch + develop_branch if enabled) or fail with clear error if config missing.
- Check if worktree exists for the branch; error if missing.
- Check `git -C <path> status`; if dirty, stop and report uncommitted changes.
- Fetch and pull: `git fetch origin <branch>` then `git pull origin <branch>`.
- **If merge conflicts occur:**
  - Report conflicted files to user
  - Return control to main session for user to resolve conflicts
  - User navigates to worktree, resolves conflicts, and commits
  - After resolution, user can re-run --update to verify
- **If clean pull succeeds:**
  - Report commits pulled count
  - Update tracking with last_checked timestamp when tracking is enabled
- Agent option: call `sc-worktree-update`; render success or handle conflicts interactively.

### --cleanup
- **Check if branch is protected first** - derive protected_branches list from git_flow config or fail if missing.
- If branch is in protected_branches list, ONLY remove worktree, NEVER delete the branch.
- Check `git -C <path> status`; if dirty, stop and request explicit approval/coordination.
- Confirm branch merged/approved for removal.
- `git worktree remove <path>` (force only with approval).
- For **non-protected branches**: If merged and has no unique commits, delete the branch locally (`git branch -d <branch>`) and remotely (`git push origin --delete <branch>`) by default. Only retain the branch if the user explicitly opts out. If the remote branch is already gone, continue without error. If not merged, only delete branches (local/remote) with explicit approval.
- For **protected branches**: Only remove worktree, preserve branch locally and remotely. Update tracking to note "worktree removed, branch preserved (protected)".
- Update tracking (remove or mark cleaned with merge SHA/date) when tracking is enabled.
- Agent option: call `sc-worktree-cleanup` with protected_branches list; render its JSON as a short summary list.

### --abort
- **Check if branch is protected first** - derive protected_branches list from git_flow config or fail if missing.
- If branch is in protected_branches list, ONLY remove worktree, NEVER delete the branch.
- Check `git -C <path> status`; if dirty, stop and request explicit approval/coordination.
- `git worktree remove <path>` (force only with approval).
- For **non-protected branches**: If requested, delete branch locally (`git branch -D <branch>`) and remotely (`git push origin --delete <branch>`).
- For **protected branches**: Only remove worktree, preserve branch locally and remotely. Require confirmation: "Branch is protected. Remove worktree but preserve branch?"
- Update tracking to remove the entry and note abandonment when tracking is enabled.
- Agent option: call `sc-worktree-abort` with protected_branches list; render its JSON as a short summary list.

### --help
- Show options and remind about base branches, paths, tracking toggles, and dirty-worktree safeguards. Keep output concise (no tool traces).


ARGUMENTS: --cleanup feature/phase10-chat-layout





  
02:22:38 assistant

{
  "args": "--cleanup feature/phase10-overlays",
  "skill": "sc-git-worktree:sc-git-worktree"
}

  "skill": "sc-git-worktree:sc-git-worktree"
